FIHR 0.1.0
  • Reference

Inference for linear functional in the high-dimensional linear regression model

LF.Rd

Computes the bias corrected estimator of linear functional for the high-dimensional linear regression model and the corresponding standard error.

LF(
  X,
  y,
  loading,
  init.Lasso = NULL,
  lambda = NULL,
  intercept = FALSE,
  mu = NULL,
  step = NULL,
  resol = 1.5,
  maxiter = 10
)

Arguments

X

Design matrix
y

Response variable
loading

observation vector in the linear functional
init.Lasso

initial LASSO estimator of the regression vector (default = NULL)
lambda

Tuning parameter in construction of LASSO estimator of the regression vector (default = NULL)
intercept

Should intercept(s) be fitted (default = FALSE)
mu

Tuning parameter in construction of projection direction (default = NULL)
step

Number of steps (< maxiter) to obtain the smallest mu that gives convergence of the optimization problem for constructing the projection direction (default = NULL)
resol

Resolution or the factor by which mu is increased/decreased to obtain the smallest mu that gives convergence of the optimization problem for constructing the projection direction (default = 1.5)
maxiter

Maximum number of steps along which mu is increased/decreased to obtain the smallest mu that gives convergence of the optimization problem for constructing the projection direction (default = 10)

Value

prop.est

The bias-corrected estimator for the linear functional

sigma

Estimate of the error variance in the linear regression model

se

Standard error of the bias-corrected estimator

proj

Optimal projection direction

step

Number of steps (< maxiter) to obtain the smallest mu that gives convergence of the optimization problem for constructing the projection direction

plug.in

Plug-in LASSO estimator for the linear functional

References

Cai T, Cai TT, Guo Z (2019). “Individualized Treatment Selection: An Optimal Hypothesis Testing Approach In High-dimensional Models.” Unknown. https://statistics.rutgers.edu/home/zijguo/Cai-Cai-Guo-ITE-Selection.pdf.

Examples

X = matrix(sample(-2:2,100*400,replace = TRUE),nrow=100,ncol=400)
beta = (1:400)/25
y = X%*%beta + rnorm(100,0,1)
LF(X = X, y = y, loading = c(1,rep(0,399)), intercept = TRUE)
#> [1] 2
#> [1] "step is 2"
#> $prop.est
#>         [,1]
#> [1,] 44.1424
#> 
#> $sigma
#> [1] 68746.61
